author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Parliamentary Budget Office (PBO) has released its latest report on Budget 2025, and it questions some of the government’s key fiscal assumptions. Interim PBO Jason Jacques said in September that his office estimated the budget’s projected deficit would be $68.5 billion, adding that Canada’s fiscal trajectory was “unsustainable” and “shocking.” The deficit for 2025 […]
title: 7 Takeaways From the Budget Watchdog’s Review of Budget 2025

author: John Carpay
description: Commentary Well-intentioned racism, to achieve the vague objective of “equity,” is still racism. The only sure path to reconciliation, social harmony, and equal opportunity in Canada is the principle of equal rights for all, special privileges for none. When the law applies differently to some Canadians because of their race, ancestry, ethnicity, or descent, the […]
title: John Carpay: Equal Rights for All, Special Privileges for None, Is the Only Path to Reconciliation

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Trade Minister Maninder Sidhu says trade talks with India won’t resume just yet, as the two countries conduct “scoping” discussions to find areas of cooperation. Sidhu, who visited India this week, said New Delhi and Ottawa are working to advance new joint ventures in many sectors from AI to critical minerals, but are still in […]
title: Canadian Trade Minister Visits India, Says Trade Talks Not Yet Resuming

author: Patrick Keeney
description: Commentary In “I Suffer Therefore I Am: Portrait of the Victim as Hero,” Pascal Bruckner exposes the moral vanity behind our obsession with victimhood. With his customary erudition, the French essayist turns his gaze upon a civilization that has transfigured suffering and pain into prestige. If Descartes proclaimed, I think, therefore I am, Bruckner’s age […]
title: Victimhood as Virtue: Pascal Bruckner and the Cult of Suffering

author: Carolina Avendano
description: The Prince Edward Island legislature has passed a bill that will make land investigation reports public, aiming to restore trust in provincial institutions following concerns over extensive land holdings by some groups on the island. The bill, brought forward by Green Party Leader Matt MacFarlane, was passed with unanimous support at the P.E.I. legislature on […]
title: PEI Passes Bill to Make Land Investigations Public Amid Chinese Interference Concerns

author: Chandra Philip
description: A former Ottawa-area teacher is contesting an attempt by the Ontario College of Teachers to force her to surrender her teaching licence over her social media comments about gender issues. Amy McKay, a former long-term occasional teacher with the Ottawa-Carleton District School Board in Ontario, was told by the regulatory body this spring that a […]
title: Former Ontario Teacher Won’t Surrender Licence Over Gender-Related Social Media Posts

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith says the province supports Ottawa’s second list of fast-tracked projects and is working with the federal government on an agreement that reflects Alberta’s priorities. Prime Minister Mark Carney on Nov. 13 announced the second tranche of so-called nation-building projects that will be referred to the Major Projects Office (MPO) for fast-tracking. […]
title: Alberta ‘Supportive’ of Carney’s 2nd Set of Projects, Still Negotiating Overhaul of Energy Policies

author: The Canadian Press
description: Rideau Hall says Gov. Gen. Mary Simon was released from hospital today and is now recovering at home. The 78-year-old head of state missed the annual Remembrance Day service in Ottawa on Tuesday after being hospitalized with a respiratory illness. The statement says Simon extends thanks to Chief Justice Richard Wagner for representing her at […]
title: Governor General Simon Released From Hospital, Recovering From Illness

author: The Canadian Press
description: Economists expect October’s annual inflation reading will show an easing from September as lower gasoline prices helped offset increases elsewhere. Statistics Canada is set to report inflation figures for last month on Monday, a change from its usual Tuesday release. A Reuters poll of economists ahead of the release predicts annual inflation fell to 2.1 […]
title: Economists Expect Annual Inflation Rate Fell in October, Driven by Lower Gas Prices

author: Lily Zhou
description: The duty-free treatment for packages under €150 could end as early as next year, affecting billions of shipments from China.
title: EU Ministers Agree to Fast-Track Crackdown on Duty-Free Rule Used by Shein, Temu

author: Alfred Bui
description: One new migrant says she had to change driving instructors due to the poor quality of training.
title: Left or Right Lane? How Australia’s Migration Boom Is Playing out in Peak Hour

author: Chandra Philip
description: Billboards situated at Toronto’s Union Station are generating concern over their use of facial detection technology without public consent. The billboards stoked controversy after a Nov. 2 Reddit post noted they used facial detection technology to observe pedestrians passing by and analyzed data about them, such as their gender and approximate age. The billboards are […]
title: Privacy Concerns Raised Over Facial Detecting Ads Near Toronto’s Union Station

author: The Canadian Press
description: The northwest branch of a light rail project in the Montreal area was officially inaugurated on Friday, with Canada’s prime minister and other dignitaries along for the first ride. Prime Minister Mark Carney and Premier François Legault were among the first invited aboard to ride the Deux-Montagnes branch of the Réseau express métropolitain, or REM, […]
title: Mark Carney Attends Launch of New Branch of Montreal-Area Light Rail Network

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Liberal government’s budget has an “overly expansive” definition of capital investments that overstates capital spending by $94 billion, and would not be able to meet its promise of balancing operational spending by 2028-29 if it used a stricter definition, according to the Parliamentary Budget Office (PBO). The PBO said in its Nov. 14 budget […]
title: Budget Watchdog Raises Doubts That Feds Will Balance Operational Deficit in Three Years

author: The Canadian Press
description: The first of three fundraising deadlines for the NDP leadership race landed Friday, and two candidates are at risk of falling short of the requirements. A campaign spokesperson for Tanille Johnston, a Campbell River B.C. city councillor, said she will “most likely” be able to make the $25,000 payment. “It’s no small feat asking our […]
title: Some NDP Leadership Candidates Could Drop out as First Fundraising Deadline Arrives

author: The Canadian Press
description: The Ontario government is considering taking control of the province’s real estate regulator after an audit into its handling of what it describes as iPro Realty’s “misappropriation” of funds. The minister of public and business service delivery said in a statement that the review of the Real Estate Council of Ontario identifies significant issues with […]
title: Ontario Weighs Taking Control of Real Estate Regulator

author: The Canadian Press
description: Enbridge Inc. has announced plans to spend US$1.4 billion to increase its capacity to ship Canadian heavy oil to the United States. The company says it has reached a final investment decision to add capacity on its Mainline network and its Flanagan South pipeline. The move comes as it says it faces customer demand to […]
title: Enbridge Spending US$1.4 Billion to Increase Shipping Capacity to US Markets

author: Victoria Friedman
description: Jaguar Land Rover was forced to pause production in early September for more than a month after it had been impacted by a ‘cyber incident.’
title: UK’s Slow Economic Growth Due in Part to Jaguar Land Rover Cyber Attack: Treasury Chief

author: Guy Birchall
description: The fresh demand comes on the heels of an energy scandal that has implicated several prominent government officials in Kyiv.
title: EU Renews Call for Ukraine to Fight Corruption Amid Energy Scandal

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Canada’s food safety regulator says it has wrapped up “active operations” at the British Columbia ostrich farm where professional marksmen culled the flock earlier this month due to an avian flu outbreak discovered late last year. The carcasses of 314 ostriches as well as eggs and other material at Universal Ostrich Farms near Edgewood, B.C., […]
title: Food Inspection Agency Says ‘Active Operations’ at BC Ostrich Farm Have Ended

author: Tom Ozimek
description: Under the deal, Washington gains expanded access to markets in Switzerland and Swiss firms pledge $200 billion in US investments.
title: US, Switzerland Reach Tariff Deal That Lowers Duties on Swiss Goods to 15 Percent

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Alberta lawyer Roger Song moved to Canada 25 years ago from China to distance himself from a regime he says he could no longer live under.  Having witnessed the 1989 Tiananmen Square massacre–when government forces opened fire on unarmed students demanding democratic reform–he says he saw Canada as a place of freedom where he and […]
title: Beijing-Born Alberta Lawyer Says ‘Wokeism’ in Canada Increasingly Resembling Communist China’s Ideological Tyranny

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Self-defence rules permitting individuals to arm themselves against an intruder may also apply in circumstances where a person refuses to leave the homeowner’s property after being asked to do so, a B.C. Supreme Court judge says. The decision published this week played a key role in the July jury acquittal of a B.C. man who […]
title: BC Judge Rules Removing an Unwelcome Guest Can Be Justified as Self-Defence

author: Chandra Philip
description: Health Canada has issued a recall for hundreds of rowing machines sold due to a fire hazard. Several models of NordicTrack rowing machines have been recalled by iFit, according to a Nov. 12 notice from Health Canada. The agency said the machines’ screen consoles have the potential to overheat and ignite. Customers are advised to […]
title: Hundreds of Rowing Machines Sold in Canada Recalled Over Risk of Fire

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: As of mid-October, more than 7 million people have been displaced within Sudan, according to the United Nations.
title: Rubio Calls to Block Foreign Arms Shipments to Sudan’s RSF Amid Reports of El-Fasher Atrocity

author: PA Media
description: Royal Mail has revealed that less than three quarters of first class mail was delivered on time over recent months, as it prepares to overhaul its letter delivery services. The delivery giant said 73.4% of first class post was delivered the next working day between June 20 and September 28. It also reported that 90.4% of […]
title: Royal Mail Delivery Performance Weakens Ahead of Second Class Post Overhaul

author: PA Media
description: Jaguar Land Rover has plunged to a heavy loss after booking almost £200 million in extra costs linked to a major cyber attack which saw the firm shut its factories for more than a month. The UK’s largest car manufacturer said its production operations have “returned to normal” after efforts to recover from the attack. […]
title: Jaguar Land Rover Plunges to Loss After Heavy Cyber Attack Costs

author: PA Media
description: Storm Claudia could bring up to a month’s worth of rain in a day as heavy downpours batter parts of England and Wales. Amber warnings for “persistent and heavy” rain come into force from noon on Friday until midnight and cover parts of Wales, the Midlands, the South West, the South East, and East of […]
title: Storm Claudia to Bring Month’s Worth of Rain in a Day With Warnings of Flooding

author: PA Media
description: Doctors are “inflicting pain and misery on patients” and holding them to ransom by going on strike, the Health Secretary has said. Wes Streeting told LBC radio the five-day resident doctors’ strike in England is “going to set us back” as he accused British Medical Association (BMA) “activists” of “damaging” NHS recovery. In a heated […]
title: Doctors Holding Patients to Ransom by Going on Strike – Streeting

author: PA Media
description: The Chancellor has abandoned plans to hike income tax at the Budget because of improved economic forecasting. Rachel Reeves had been expected to hike income tax in the face of a yawning gap in her spending plans, hinting as recently as Monday that the alternative would be “deep cuts” to public investment. But reporting overnight […]
title: Chancellor Abandons Planned Income Tax Hike Because of Improved Forecasts

author: Rachel Roberts
description: The Pentagon said that the proposed sale would improve Taiwan’s 'capability to meet current and future threats.'
title: US Agrees to $330 Million Sale of Fighter Jets to Taiwan, Drawing Rebuke From China

author: Gerry Bowler
description: Sandford Fleming’s vision permanently altered how societies measure, understand, and organize time.
title: How a Missed Train in 1876 Led to the Adoption of Standard Time

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The return leaves just three deceased hostages unaccounted for in Gaza, advancing the first phase of the cease-fire agreement.
title: Israel Confirms Recovery of Hostage’s Body From Gaza

author: Kimberly Hayek
description: The agreement covers nuclear submarines, AI, shipbuilding, and tariff cuts to boost trade and regional security.
title: US and South Korea Finalize Trade and Security Agreement

author: PA Media
description: Sir Keir Starmer has said he “of course” retains full confidence in his under-pressure chief of staff Morgan McSweeney after being “assured that no briefing against ministers was done from No 10”. The Prime Minister vowed to “absolutely deal with anybody responsible” for the briefing war that erupted at the top of the Labour Government. […]
title: Starmer Backs Chief of Staff After Assurances Briefing Did Not Come From No 10

author: PA Media
description: Flooding could hit parts of the UK on Friday as forecasters issued an amber warning for rain. Storm Claudia, which was named by the Spanish meteorological service, will bring heavy downpours and strong winds for much of the country. Some areas could see up to 80mm of rain, with deep floodwater causing a danger to […]
title: Amber Warning Issued as Storm Claudia to Sweep UK Over Washout Weekend

author: PA Media
description: The NHS has published its latest monthly performance figures for hospitals in England, which show referrals for cancer treatment have slipped further behind target and A&E “corridor care” remains high, though the overall waiting list has fallen. Here, the PA news agency looks at the key statistics: The waiting list for routine hospital treatment has […]
title: NHS Hospital Performance in England: Latest Numbers and Trends

author: PA Media
description: Police and crime commissioners in England and Wales will be scrapped by the Government, it has been announced. The elected officials were first introduced in 2012 and their responsibilities include setting budgets for their police forces and appointing the most senior officer—the chief constable—for their area. But ministers plan to abolish the role in 2028 […]
title: Police and Crime Commissioners to Be Scrapped

author: PA Media
description: A new fleet of facial recognition vans are to be rolled out by seven police forces across the UK in an expanded pilot programme. The Metropolitan Police, South Wales Police and Essex Police have been using the facial recognition vans for some time to mixed receptions. The software enables officers to use cameras mounted on […]
title: New Facial Recognition Vans Rolled Out for Use by 7 More Police Forces

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The crackdown has cancelled thousands of faulty certificates and forced multiple training providers to shut their doors.
title: Australia’s Largest Vocational Training Cleanup Cancels 30,000 Qualifications

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: B.C. employees will no longer be required to get a sick note from their doctor for illnesses under five days, according to changes by the B.C. government to ease the burden on doctors. The province said Nov. 12 the new rules will free up doctors to spend more time with patients and bars employers from […]
title: To Ease Doctor Burdens, BC Workers No Longer Need Sick Notes for Short-Term Illness: Province

author: Daniel Y. Teng, Rex Widerstrom
description: His comments come in response to Australian journalist Cheng Lei's concerns that locals have a deep fear of Beijing.
title: Stronger Support Needed so Chinese-Australians Can Freely Criticise Beijing: Academic

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: A campaign that sought to gamify the debate on abortion by selling parliamentary buzzwords has triggered legal questions and been referred for review.
title: Anti-Abortion ‘Word Game’ Referred to Authorities for Investigation

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Queensland's LNP members have voted against payroll tax, but what do the experts think?
title: Abolish or Keep? The Big Divide Over Payroll Tax

author: Jarvis Lim
description: The strategy is fueling backlash that now threatens Beijing's own interests, say experts.
title: China’s Economic Push in Burma Enables Junta Atrocities: Analysts

author: The Associated Press
description: SEOUL, South Korea—A truck plowed into pedestrians at an outdoor market in South Korea on Thursday, killing two people and injuring 18, officials said. The two people were pronounced dead at a hospital following the incident shortly before 11 a.m. in Bucheon city, near the capital of Seoul. Nine people sustained serious injuries among the […]
title: Truck Hits Pedestrians at Market in South Korea, Killing 2 and Injuring 18

author: Cindy Li
description: 'Obviously, the matter’s quite tough, and it’s drawn a lot of attention, but we're getting through it,' said Michael Korn, Yang Lanlan's lawyer.
title: Mysterious Chinese Heiress Pleads Not Guilty in Major Rolls-Royce Crash

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The transgender debate is often categorised as a niche or 'culture war' political issue irrelevant to mainstream Australians.
title: Is the Transgender Debate a ‘Culture War’ Issue or Does It Matter to Broader Society?

author: Joseph Lord
description: The military branch said that, on Oct. 29, it detected a Russian vessel approximately 15 miles south of Oahu, Hawaii.
title: US Monitoring Russian Ship Operating in International Waters Near Hawaii

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Several ACT schools have been closed—some entirely, others partially—after asbestos-contaminated coloured sand was detected in classrooms.
title: ACT Closes Over 20 Public Schools Over Asbestos Concerns in Play Sand

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Government report flags oversight gaps and unclear benchmarks.
title: Multi-Billion Dollar Climate Program Became a ‘Tick Box Exercise’: Internal Report

author: Chandra Philip
description: B.C. RCMP said they have helped in dismantling a global cybercrime network in an international police operation that involved law enforcement from eight other countries. As part of the operation, which started in 2022, police helped dismantle software and online infrastructure being used by the criminals to steal personal information from devices, they said. The […]
title: BC RCMP Help Dismantle Worldwide Cybercrime Network

author: Dorothy Li
description: The Chinese communist regime is identified as the worst offender, followed by Turkey, Tajikistan, and Russia.
title: EU Must Confront Transnational Repression of Human Rights Defenders, Lawmakers Say

description: Submarine building experience, a skilled workforce, and less red tape will likely give the Asian nation an advantage.

description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Teachers’ Strike in Mexico, Anniversary of Terrorist Attacks in France, and World Cheese Awards

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney unveiled the latest list of major projects his government is referring to the Major Projects Office (MPO) for approval. The Building Canada Act, passed in June as part of Bill C-5, gives the federal government the ability to designate certain “nation-building” projects for streamlined review and approval through the MPO, which […]
title: 6 Key Takeaways From Carney’s Second Major Projects Announcement

author: Emel Akan
description: The agreements will provide tariff relief on certain goods while opening foreign markets for U.S goods, a senior administration official said.
title: US Reaches Framework Trade Deals With Argentina, Guatemala, El Salvador, and Ecuador
